byline.contributor: Anne Barnard reported from Beirut, and Mark Mazzetti from Washington. Reporting was contributed by Hwaida Saad from Beirut, Andrew E. Kramer from Moscow, Maher Samaan from Paris, and an employee of The New York Times from Damascus, Syria.
byline.original: By ANNE BARNARD and MARK MAZZETTI

headline.print_headline: U.S. Airstrike, Intended for ISIS, Kills Syrian Government Troops
headline.main: U.S. Admits Airstrike in Syria, Meant to Hit ISIS, Killed Syrian Troops

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations

snippet: The United States military said the planes stopped the attack after a warning from Russia, which said 62 Syrian troops were killed and 100 more wounded....
lead_paragraph: The United States military said the planes stopped the attack after a warning from Russia, which said 62 Syrian troops were killed and 100 more wounded.
